info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 9:42AM EDT until August 28 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN BOONE AND CENTRAL KANAWHA COUNTIES... At 942 AM EDT, Radar and gauge reports indicated between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen this morning. Although the heavy rain has since ended, runoff will continue to result in flash flooding. There are several water rescues occurring, particularly along Coal River Road in the communities of Comfort and Seth. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and public reports. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Racine and Seth. This includes the following streams and drainages... Drawdy Creek, Brush Creek, Laurel Creek, Rock Creek, Big Coal Creek, Joes Creek, Lens Creek, Hopkins Fork, and Slaughter Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
